root_causes: Missing entry condition: the script does not restrict checks to respondents who meet entry condition f('qSurveyType').none('2'), so it will flag respondents who were not in scope.
Validation selection is applied globally (miss(S8) or ~range(S8,1,3)) without combining with the question's entry condition.
instructions: Restrict the validation to only respondents meeting the entry condition. Replace the sel if line with one that combines the entry condition and the validation, for example: sel if f('qSurveyType').none('2') and (miss(S8) or ~range(S8,1,3)).

If there are survey-specific special codes (e.g. 97/98/99) that should be treated as valid or excluded, update the validation range accordingly (e.g. ~range(S8,1,3) should be adjusted to allow those codes if they are valid).

root_causes: Entry condition f('qSurveyType').none('2') is not enforced in the SPSS script
Script does not check that S8 is blank when qSurveyType = 2 (non-eligible respondents)
instructions: Enforce the entry condition so validation only applies when qSurveyType != 2. For example: sel if qSurveyType<>2 and (miss(S8) or ~range(S8,1,3)). list respid, qSurveyType, S8.
Add a complementary check to ensure S8 is blank for respondents who should not see the question (qSurveyType = 2). For example: sel if qSurveyType=2 and ~miss(S8). list respid, qSurveyType, S8.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: the script does not account for qSurveyType (should only validate when qSurveyType != 2).
Current selection flags missing/out-of-range for all respondents, including those who should be skipped.
instructions: Include the entry condition on qSurveyType in the selection logic. Replace the current select statement with one that validates only when qSurveyType<>2 and also flags answers provided when qSurveyType=2.

Example replacement (SPSS logic): sel if (qSurveyType<>2 and (miss(S8) or ~range(S8,1,3))) or (qSurveyType=2 and ~miss(S8)). This will: a) flag missing or out-of-range S8 when the question should be asked, and b) flag any S8 responses when the question should have been skipped.

root_causes: Entry condition f('qSurveyType').none('2') is not implemented in the validation logic
The script does not enforce that S8 must be missing when qSurveyType = 2 (non-applicable cases)
instructions: Apply the entry condition so validation runs only for respondents where qSurveyType <> 2 and ensure S8 is missing when qSurveyType = 2.

Update the selection logic to something like: sel if (qSurveyType<>2 and (miss(S8) or ~range(S8,1,3))) or (qSurveyType=2 and ~miss(S8)). This flags missing/out-of-range values when applicable and flags non-missing values when not applicable.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: the script does not restrict checks to respondents where qSurveyType != 2 (f('qSurveyType').none('2')). As written, it validates S8 for all respondents.
instructions: Restrict the validation to respondents meeting the entry condition. Change the selection to include qSurveyType <> 2. For example: sel if qSurveyType <> 2 and (miss(S8) or ~range(S8,1,3)).
Ensure the entry condition is applied exactly as in the spec (f('qSurveyType').none('2')) so only the Remaining Section A respondents are checked.

root_causes: Missing entry condition f('qSurveyType').none('2') — the script validates S4 for all respondents instead of only for Section A (qSurveyType != '2').
instructions: Apply the entry condition so validation only runs for respondents where qSurveyType none '2'. For example, wrap the existing check with the entry filter: sel if f('qSurveyType').none('2') & (miss(S4) or ~any(S4,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,21,22,23,31,32,33,34,36,37,41,42,43,44,45,51,52,53,61,62,63,64,65,66,67,68,69,70,71,98)).

root_causes: Missing entry condition f('qCountry').any('7') && isTest() — validation runs for all respondents.
Question is NotRequired, but the script flags missing responses (it uses miss(HidS4DE) in the selection), which is incorrect for NotRequired questions.
instructions: Do not validate missing values for this NotRequired question. Remove the miss(HidS4DE) part and only flag non-missing values that are outside allowed codes.
Add the entry condition so validation only runs in test mode for country code 7. For example: sel if f('qCountry').any('7') & isTest() & ~any(HidS4DE,1,2).
If you must keep a listing line, ensure it is executed only under the same entry condition and that missing HidS4DE values are not treated as errors.

root_causes: Missing entry condition f('qCountry').any('1033') && f('HidS1Group2').any('1') — the script validates S4a0 for all respondents.
instructions: Apply the entry condition so validation only runs for respondents where qCountry = 1033 and HidS1Group2 = 1. Example: sel if f('qCountry').any('1033') & f('HidS1Group2').any('1') & (miss(S4a0) or ~range(S4a0,1,2)).
Keep the allowed answer codes (1 and 2) in the range/any() check as present.

root_causes: Entry condition is false (question is not applicable) but the script still validates S4a responses.
Missing entry-condition handling: validation should be suppressed when the entry condition is false.
instructions: Do not perform validation for S4a because its entry condition is false. Remove or disable this validation script (i.e., do not run sel if miss(S4a) or ~range(S4a,1,2)).

If the intent was to condition on S4 (e.g. f('S4').any('1')), replace the false entry condition with the correct one and wrap the validation accordingly. Otherwise, ensure the selection is effectively never true (e.g., sel if false) so no cases are flagged.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: the script does not restrict validation to cases where f('qSurveyType').none('2') (Section A).
instructions: Add the entry condition for qSurveyType so the check only runs for Section A respondents. For example, change the selection to include qSurveyType<>2: sel if (qSurveyType <> 2) & (miss(S4) or ~any(S4,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,21,22,23,31,32,33,34,36,37,41,42,43,44,45,51,52,53,61,62,63,64,65,66,67,68,69,70,71,98)).
Leave the list of allowed codes as-is (the any(...) list matches the expected answer codes).

root_causes: Missing entry condition: the script does not restrict checks to f('qCountry').any('7') && isTest().

Incorrect mapping logic: code treats S4 value 23 (Mix of hospital and office-based) as Hospital (HidS4DE_chk=1), but expected mapping labels 'Mix' under the Office-based OR Mix category (answer code 2).
instructions: Implement the entry condition so the check only runs when qCountry = 7 and in test mode. For example: sel if (qCountry = 7 AND isTest() = 1) & (miss(HidS4DE) or ~range(HidS4DE,1,2) or (HidS4DE_chk <> HidS4DE)).

Fix the computed classification logic so that S4=23 (Mix) maps to answer code 2 (Office-based OR Mix). For example: compute HidS4DE_chk = 2. if any(S4,21) HidS4DE_chk = 1. /* do not include 23 in the hospital list */
If other S4 codes should be considered hospital or office for this country, expand the any(...) lists accordingly so the derived HidS4DE_chk matches the expected mapping.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: the script does not restrict validation to respondents with qCountry=1033 AND HidS1Group2=1.
instructions: Add the entry condition so the check only runs when qCountry = 1033 and HidS1Group2 = 1. For example: sel if (qCountry = 1033 AND HidS1Group2 = 1) & (miss(S4a0) or ~range(S4a0,1,2)).
Keep the answer-code validation (range 1-2) as-is once the entry condition is applied.

root_causes: Entry condition is 'false' (question should not be shown), but the script performs validation unconditionally.
instructions: Do not run any validation for S4a because the entry condition is false (the question is not shown). Remove the temporary/sel/list block for S4a from the script, or ensure the selection reflects the false condition (e.g., sel if 0).
If the intended behavior changes and S4a should be shown when S4 = 1, implement that explicit entry condition instead: sel if (S4 = 1) & (miss(S4a) or ~range(S4a,1,2)).

root_causes: Entry condition not enforced: expected to run only when qSurveyType != 2 but SPSS script does not restrict by qSurveyType
Potentially flags respondents who were not eligible to see S4 (false positives) because selection ignores display logic
instructions: Apply the entry condition in the selection statement. Modify the sel if to restrict checks to respondents who were shown the question. Example approach: sel if qSurveyType NE 2 AND (miss(S4) OR ~any(S4,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,21,22,23,31,32,33,34,36,37,41,42,43,44,45,51,52,53,61,62,63,64,65,66,67,68,69,70,71,98)).
If qSurveyType uses different coding or a derived flag, substitute the correct variable/values representing 'not 2' so only displayed respondents are validated.

root_causes: Entry condition not enforced: expected to show only for qCountry = 7 and in test mode (isTest()), but SPSS script does not restrict by qCountry or test-mode
Validation runs for all respondents and may incorrectly flag those who were not intended to see this question
instructions: Enforce the entry condition when selecting cases. For example: sel if qCountry = 7 AND test_flag = 1 AND (miss(HidS4DE) OR ~range(HidS4DE,1,2)). Replace test_flag with the actual variable that indicates test mode (or with an appropriate indicator if available).
If no test-mode variable exists in the data extract, do not run validation unless you can reliably identify test respondents; otherwise remove or comment out the unconditional validation.

root_causes: Entry condition not enforced: expected to validate only when qCountry = 1033 and HidS1Group2 = 1 but SPSS script does not restrict by these variables
May produce false positives by flagging respondents who never saw S4a0
instructions: Restrict the validation to respondents who were shown the question. Example: sel if qCountry = 1033 AND HidS1Group2 = 1 AND (miss(S4a0) OR ~range(S4a0,1,2)).
Confirm the exact variable names and codes for the conditions (qCountry and HidS1Group2) in the dataset and substitute them if different.

root_causes: Entry condition indicates the question is never shown (false), but SPSS script unconditionally validates the variable
Validation will flag missing values for a question that should not be displayed, causing incorrect QC failures
instructions: Do not generate unconditional validation code for a question with entry condition 'false'. Remove the sel/list block for S4a or wrap it with the correct display condition if the question can ever be shown.

If the question may be shown under some corrected logic, replace 'false' with the proper entry condition and then restrict the sel if accordingly, e.g.: sel if <entry_condition> AND (miss(S4a) OR ~range(S4a,1,2)). Otherwise delete this validation code.
